fixes.name: Bins
fixes.dax_expression:
SWITCH(
    TRUE(),
    'historicoEducacionCLEAN (historicoEducacionCLEAN)'[Edad graduando ] <= 19 && 'historicoEducacionCLEAN (historicoEducacionCLEAN)'[Edad graduando ] <=19, "Menor de 20",
    'historicoEducacionCLEAN (historicoEducacionCLEAN)'[Edad graduando ] >= 20 && 'historicoEducacionCLEAN (historicoEducacionCLEAN)'[Edad graduando ] <=25, "20-25",
    'historicoEducacionCLEAN (historicoEducacionCLEAN)'[Edad graduando ] >= 26 && 'historicoEducacionCLEAN (historicoEducacionCLEAN)'[Edad graduando ] <=30, "26-30",
    'historicoEducacionCLEAN (historicoEducacionCLEAN)'[Edad graduando ] >= 31 && 'historicoEducacionCLEAN (historicoEducacionCLEAN)'[Edad graduando ] <=40, "31-40",
    'historicoEducacionCLEAN (historicoEducacionCLEAN)'[Edad graduando ] >= 41 && 'historicoEducacionCLEAN (historicoEducacionCLEAN)'[Edad graduando ] <=50, "41-50",
    'historicoEducacionCLEAN (historicoEducacionCLEAN)'[Edad graduando ] >= 51 && 'historicoEducacionCLEAN (historicoEducacionCLEAN)'[Edad graduando ] <=60, "51-60",
    'historicoEducacionCLEAN (historicoEducacionCLEAN)'[Edad graduando ] >= 61 && 'historicoEducacionCLEAN (historicoEducacionCLEAN)'[Edad graduando ] <=69, "60-69",
    BLANK()
)
fixes.solution_explanation: Converted the Tableau IF / ELSEIF ladder to a DAX SWITCH(TRUE()) expression. All column references were transformed to the 'TableName'[Column] format using the provided table name. The multi-branch string outputs were preserved as double-quoted literals. No aggregations or parameters are used, so this is implemented as a row-level calculated column.
